description: Borrowed from Yiddish שמועס‎ (shmues), from Hebrew שְׁמוּעוֹת‎ (sh'mu'ót), plural of שְׁמוּעָה‎ (sh'mu'á, “report, piece of news, rumor”).

entries.meaning: A casual conversation, especially one held in order to gain an advantage or make a social connection.

verbs.description: schmooze (third-person singular simple present schmoozes, present participle schmoozing, simple past and past participle schmoozed)

entries.meaning: To talk casually, especially in order to gain an advantage or make a social connection.
examples: I wish he could do his job as well as he schmoozes with the boss.
